reviews.review_msg: Frederick is the greatest professor I met at SFU. He is sooooooooo nice and patient, and he explains the concept clearly. If you ask him questions by email, he responds quickly and clearly. For the online course, we only get weekly quizzes, assignments and one report. Also, he gives fair marks. I highly recommend you take his course!

Despite the course being quite technical, Yuriy made this class very interesting! As long as you pay attention in class and ensure you understand the homework questions, you will be fine. His exams are pretty difficult, but nothing crazy if you put the work in.

I took BUS 315 with yuriy and he was a great prof. His class was engaging and his explanations were clear. His final exam was straightforward, and he went over similar questions in class. If Yuriy ever teaches a 400 level finance course, I will take it with him. Highly recommend

Hes a smart guy for sure, abundance of knowledge inside of his brain. However, he has an unorthadox way of teaching. His notes only have questions and doesnt have the solved answer. He tends to use a lot of real life examples but wont allow for an extensive formula sheet during exams. He picks a couple to have on there. Okay but not the best prof.
He is nice, approachable and handsome :) Explain concepts very clearly. However, the tests are a bit heavy and long, especially the final.

I took his Bus315 prior to taking my CFA level 1. There was a lot of correspondence between what we learned in class and what was on the actual CFA exam. Never had problems getting help from him as he was always willing to help after class or during office hours. Final was challenging. Since I was preparing for both exams well I got A.
No Comments
good
no preparation for any lectures at all. no answer keys given to practice questions. confusing grading system..need to say more?
This class single handedly destroyed my will to live
Would NOT recommend.

Hardly complain about profs, but Greta is brutal. Very difficult to understand, not because of an accent but a horrendous ability to explain concepts. Spends years on pointless terms then whips through the mathematical portions. It's a self-learning class. Her TA Terrell is an inaccurate marker.  Pros- Straightforward exams, tries(ish) to help.
Greta is a nice person, but her lectures are sometimes hard to understand because she speaks fast. However, the averages are low so it is not hard to beat them.

I'll start by saying that the midterm and final averages were in the 40s. This is with a 10% completion mark for assignments, increasing the weight of those exams. She can't teach and hates that students don't attend her lectures in a never-ending cycle. She is a nice person, but a terrible professor, not sure how she is tenured.

She is outrightly the worst professor I have encountered until now at Beedie. She is not fit to be an educator at any scholastic level. Further, she mumbles and speaks at an astronomical pace which no one can really comprehend. Narrates off slides, cancels classes, scrambles material and sets terribly hard examinations (averages were insanely low).
she should take EDUC 100 instead of teaching... (she'd probably fail)

Assignments are too simple to cover all materials of the chapter. She rushed through everything and did not even take effort to explain the material properly with examples. 
Midterms were fair if you did all the end of chapter exercises in the textbook, but final is terrible. She even canceled a class without any explainations.

I have had two classes with Greta and I would highly recommend avoiding her. She showed up late to every lecture and often rushes through content. The assignments were fairly basic and seem easy but then the exams were exponentially more difficult. Every exam I have done with her had a class avg of under 45%. She is nice but not a helpful prof.
If you can avoid, do yourself a favour.

She is very unorganized. She canceled classes and scrambled everything in the end. Her midterms will be a lot harder than the assignments and will require to memorize all the terms. Highly recommend getting the textbook and do the practice problems as her assignment and midterms will be from the textbook. If you can, just avoid her.
The worst professor I have ever had by far, not even close. Do not take any classes with her. AVOID at ALL COSTS.
Really Bad Professor. Inaccessible and does not answer emails or questions.

Easily the worst Professor I have had in my 4 years here at SFU. Makes concepts much more complex then they need to be. You can barely understand what she says because of her accent. She will never respond to your emails even though she says to email her if anyone has any questions. 

Do yourself a favor and save your sanity by not taking her.

She is an outstanding finance lecturer whose dedication and expertise significantly contributed to students' understanding of the subject. With an engaging teaching style, she adeptly demystified complex financial concepts, making them accessible and relatable. She went above and beyond to support her students' learning journey.

THE WORST professor I had in my whole 4 year degree. She has ruined my interest in finance. I got the class average grade by navigating everything through YouTube. DO NOT take her. You will just cry and learn nothing...I am serious NOTHING! I am planning to retake this course just to better understand the concepts. (Inspire I got a B).
Good class...  Maybe just a little bit too much theory.

This guy is a decent lecturer. B/c most of the stuff he teaches is theoretical, it is sometimes hard to follow.  His exams are largely based on what he says and his half-written notes. So make sure you attend all lectures. Simply studying the book is not going to cut it in his classes.

WORST prof ever! His exams r super hard, you wont know how to do it even u studied really hard for it.  And the course is hard itself, with this unhelpful prof, it's a nightmare. If you're smart enough yourself, and you wanna challenge yourself, take him; or else, DONT! Duno how he could still teach
is just a waste of time of going to his class. no matter how hard u study,you will never know how to do the exams.... sigh.. midterm is unreasonable
Oh my goodness that test was impossible

i wasn't gonna write anything but since I have seen the name, Zitron, I have to write it for those who might take a course with this guy. Simply don't take any course with him! He totally doesn't know how to teach! Don't waste time and money!!
maybe he is good at teaching other courses, but he really bad at teaching BUS315!!!
He sucks!He doesn't know how to teach and makes the exam superhard!!! Highly not recommanded!!!
Very boring and unnecessary lectures. Does provide past tests so easy to teach yourself the material. You wont need the textbook. There are probably better options.

She is really nice and gentle! Although her ppt looks like a bit colorful, but once you familiar with this format you will find those colors actually help you understand. Also, she will provide enough practice and sample before test, which are quite helpful. She is also willing to answer questions and explained very clear.

She is nice and willing to help students but she puts way too much info on each slide. It is a four hour lecture and theres way too much info to absorb. And its really confusing, you have to spend time organizing it

I really don't want to sound harsh because she's nice, but I think I went color blind from her slides.  She reads off the power points and using the mouse to draw all over her slides in red. If she wants to do that, at least get a lecture hall that allows you to draw on the touch screen, or use the overhead.  You do not learn anything in class.

Her lectures consist of her pointing at her powerpoint when a red pointer and reading it out loud as if we are in kindergarten. She spent more time making her slides colorful (literally every word in the slide is a different color) than actually teaching investments. Marking is fair, not a overall hard course, but you must teach yourself.
great prof, take this class with him if you were good at bus315&316
If you really want to learn something meat and real finance stuff, take with Prof. Yee.  Knowledgeable. Accessible. Encouraging. Patient. Very nice professor.

He was good at explaining concepts, but at times his notes are way too colorful. Biggest problem I had was that the questions he would assign and give answers to were very easy, in other words, it was hard to prepare for tests that were actually difficult, such as his mid-term and final. Tough to do well b/c of lack of ability to prepare for exams

I took BUS315 with Professor Yee. He is always there for students who have questions. I asked so many questions through the whole semester and many of them are repeated until I understand. Professor Yee was always patient and asked my questions again and again. His lecture notes are super clear. I am so glad to attend lectures with him.

Well, at least he is more practical than Heaney, and doesn't focus on formula proofs. Still, Beedie can't seem to find a really good 315 prof. Hard to know how to do well because he doesn't give answers to textbook qsts. I tried to memorize the text, should've just memorized his slides. Be prepared for his quizzes, you can't really wing them

He is a very nice prof. I asked for answers of the assigned questions. He provided all of those even though I didn't attend his lectures. Notes are very clear. I just read his lecture notes and got good mark on the quiz.

Avoid him at all cost. He does not give answers to the questions that he assigns. He goes over the answers in class VERY QUICKLY, and if you try to copy the answers down, he gets mad and scolds at you in front of the whole class. He expects us to know the answers by reading his slides (which are way too colorful).

Take this course if you have trouble sleeping. He will definitely put you to sleep. Tries to cover way too much in too little time. His lecture notes are a mess and you'd be hard pressed to stay awake during the entire lecture. The best thing he's done for me is that he has made me realize how useless portfolio managers are.

Derek doesn't teach u anything besides his slides, my frds had a lot more fun with another prof. i get better grades reading the text book myself, so if u can take it next sem with another prof, wise to do it.

Final was much more difficult than MT.  Assignments are very time consuming & randomly collected. Derek tries to cover too much material in too little time. Material learned in class is very impractical and rarely used in the real world.

Defineately one of the hardest courses at SFU! So much information to learn in a short period of time. Yee tried his best to clarify the material but he tends to rush through his lectures so it was hard to follow him. Overall, his exams are fair.
Derek is beautiful...When he wears his CFA hat, it makes my heart melt.

Freakin boring... skipped almost every lecture, studied all in ONE whole night and final exam was rather easy! Textbook are useless, stupid project, and lectures notes extremely long... I fall alsleep in class everytime.
boring teaching style, just covering slides one by one. should work out problems in lecture, but he never writes anything. therefore you can not follow those numbers without calculation.
Ok at teaching, sometimes annoying when he uses his laser pointer too much... lecture is very boring, useless... long lecture notes!
helps out alot.. spends alot of time helping his students!
